instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Disappearing trackpad and keyboard at login
threads.message:
A real magic show

So when holding alt to select boot drive the trackpad and keyboard work a charm. Even Ubuntu has got it right. 
The very moment it goes to OS login screen both keyboard and trackpad are disabled. 

Things I have tried

*New KB Flex
*New Trackpad and Flex
*Inspecting for corrosion and any damaged joints. 

Voltages are present as you can feel the trackpad clicking too. 

Seems like mid boot that the caps key stops lightig up. 

Anyone experienced this before and literally any advice would be greatly appreciated?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Disappearing trackpad and keyboard at login
threads.message:
Once logged into OSX, SPI mode is activated.
Before that, PCH is accessed through USB.
Check any SPI related signals for trackpad.
